Dear Jason Lheureux:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. No
substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Samantha Way at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Cathrine Raftery, Licensing Consultant

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000938
Special Investigation Intake Date: 08/13/2025
License #: CI410201226

Licensee Designee: David Gorman
Chief Administrator: Jason Lheureux
Agency Name: KENTWOOD CAMPUS
Agency Address: 3290 36TH ST
GRAND RAPIDS, MI 49512-8193
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 03/01/2027
Capacity: 36

1

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 8/12/25, a staff member was trying to get a bracelet back from
a youth. After retrieving the bracelet, the staff member shoved the
youth down on the bed. The staff member then started play
fighting with the youth. The staff member was playing but their
punches were hurting the youth.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed face to face at the facility on
August 14, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Complainant reported she works in an ancillary service at the
facility. She reported she works directly with Youth A and noted
she felt she had a good relationship with him. Complaint reported
on August 13, 2025, Youth A came running up to her when she
was outside at the facility. She reported Youth A stated Supervisor
found out he had a bracelet from his girlfriend on another unit that
he was not allowed to have. Complainant reported Youth A stated
Supervisor told him he would get a two-month ground and unit-
based restrictions if he would not give up the bracelet. She
reported the bracelet was considered contraband because the
youth are not allowed to date at the facility. Complainant reported
Youth A then reported Supervisor pushed him onto his bed and
played fought with him. She reported Youth A stated Supervisor
had punched him and stated it hurt him. Complainant reported she
did not get to ask him for more details because he was going to
the work program at the facility. She reported Youth A reported
this occurred on August 12, 2025, before 3pm.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
14, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Foster Care
Worker was present with Youth A during this interview. When
this consultant and MDHHS Worker met with Youth A, Foster
Care Worker had already met with him prior. After MDHHS
Worker completed the forensic interview protocol, it was found
Foster Care Worker had read the allegations to Youth A and noted
she did not know she was not allowed to do this. Youth A was
2

asked to explain what happened on August 11, 2025, and he
reported it started with Supervisor finding out he had received a
bracelet from his girlfriend, who lives on another unit at the facility.
He reported they were not supposed to date at the facility, so the
bracelet was considered contraband, and he could get
consequences for having it. Youth A reported Supervisor and Staff
1 walked into his room to talk about this. He reported he was
laying on his bed watching a movie while Supervisor stood in the
room and Staff 1 stood in the doorway. Youth A reported he tried
to lie to Supervisor first about the bracelet but then ended up
giving it to her. He reported because he gave up the bracelet, he
did not get any consequences. Youth A reported Supervisor never
put her hands on him, never play-fought with him, or pushed him
on his bed. He reported he did tell someone about having to give
up his bracelet, but never that Supervisor pushed him or play
fought with him. Youth A reported Supervisor is a good support
and helps him to focus on his treatment goals. He reported he has
never seen Supervisor push anyone or play fight.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed face to face at the facility
on August 14, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Foster Care Worker reported she has never heard concerns from
Youth A about Supervisor or about the facility. She reported when
she spoke with him before the interview, he reported the same
information he told during his interview. Foster Care Worker
reported Youth A denied ever getting pushed by Supervisor or that
she play fought with him.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
August 19, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
MDHHS Worker read the allegations to Supervisor, who then
reported she would never harm Youth A. Supervisor reported on
August 11, 2025, she was notified by the supervisor of the girl’s
unit, stating that at school, Youth A was given a bracelet from the
girl that he had a crush on. She reported this is considered to be
contraband, so she asked Staff 1 to come with her to ask Youth A
about the bracelet. Supervisor reported she would never go into a
youth’s room alone or confront a youth alone about a situation.
She reported she went down to Youth A’s room and asked him
about the bracelet. Supervisor reported Youth A first denied that
he had it, and she told him that she had proof he had it, so he
would be on unit-based restrictions until she received the bracelet.
She reported that as soon as she was about to walk out of the
room, Youth A grabbed her arm and gave the bracelet to her.
Supervisor reported Youth A became emotional and stated he did
not want the girl to get in trouble because he really cared about
3

her. She reported Youth A hugged her. Supervisor reported Staff
1 was present throughout the situation and stated it only lasted a
few minutes. She reported she has a positive relationship with
Youth A and always tries to encourage him to focus on his
treatment goals rather than any of the drama that goes on.
Supervisor denied ever pushing, punching, or horseplaying with
Youth A. She reported it is all inappropriate and that is why she
always has another staff member with her, because when
situations arise like this, she has a witness.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on August 19, 2025, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported on August
11, 2025, he was asked by Supervisor to accompany her to Youth
A’s room because he was given a bracelet by a female youth in
another unit. He reported he and Supervisor were in Youth A’s
room for a short period of time. Supervisor first asked Youth A
about the bracelet, and Youth A tried to state he did not have it.
He reported Youth A then gave up the bracelet to Supervisor.
Staff 1 reported Supervisor handled the situation appropriately. He
denied seeing Supervisor ever put her hands on Youth A, push
Youth A, or play fight with Youth A. Staff 1 reported if he was to
have seen that behavior, he is a mandated reporter and would
have to call in a physical abuse complaint. He reported he has
never had a concern about Supervisor’s interactions with any of
the youth.
Video Recording
Video recording of August 11, 2025 during the time of
3:35pm- 3:44pm was reviewed by this consultant and MDHHS
Worker on August 19, 2025. This video recording was
reviewed at the facility in collaboration with Manager. It
should be noted there is no audio. The video took place in the
hallway of Youth A’s bedroom. At the start of the video at 3:35pm
there was no one in the hallway. At 3:36pm, Youth A is seen
walking down the hallway to his bedroom which is the furthest
away door on the right side. Youth A then enters his bedroom on
his own. At 3:41pm, Supervisor and Staff 1 are seen walking down
the hallway, heading towards Youth A’s bedroom. Supervisor
walked into the bedroom and Staff 1 stood in the doorway with the
door open. There is no camera view to see the inside of Youth A’s
bedroom. At 3:44pm, Supervisor and Staff 1 are seen walking out
of Youth A’s bedroom and heading back down the hall towards the
main milieu area.
Documentation Reviewed:
- Human Resource file for Supervisor- Supervisor has
been working at the facility since October 2009. In the past
4

seven years, Supervisor has not had any disciplinary
actions noted within her HR file. Supervisor is in
compliance with all required trainings. Her most recent de-
escalation/restraint model training was 09/11/2024.
- Facility Employee Handbook- Within the section that
notes employee/client relationship guidelines it stated,
“Employees serve as role models for those we serve in our
venues by providing consistent, therapeutic care aligned
with Wedgwood’s Mission and values.” This section also
notes, “Examples of inappropriate responses/involvement,
especially to clients who are youth, include, but are not
limited to: Horseplay, as it can be inappropriate for some
children.”
- Facility Behavior Management Procedures- Prohibited
Techniques with the most recent revision date of June
2, 2025- This policy notes that any physical punishment
including spanking, hitting, pinching, slapping, hair pulling,
mouth washing, sitting or standing in a specific position,
strenuous physical exercise or threatening to use any of
these methods is prohibited.
Analysis There was no violation found of Supervisor pushing Youth A or
play fighting with Youth A. In interviews with Supervisor and Youth
A they both denied Supervisor ever pushed Youth A when he was
in his bedroom or ever play fought with Youth A. Staff 1 witnessed
the interactions between Supervisor and Youth A when they were
in Youth A’s bedroom and there were no concerns noted. Staff 1
denied Supervisor ever pushed Youth A or play fought with Youth
A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
09/23/2025
